snippet: Laurel Richie, the W.N.B.A. president, says she has learned to give employees “time to think and create and develop” — and to make sure they sense a share of ownership in their work.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features interview with Women's National Basketball Assn president Laurel J Richie discussing her career and management technique.
lead_paragraph: Laurel Richie, the W.N.B.A. president, says she has learned to give employees “time to think and create and develop” — and to make sure they sense a share of ownership in their work.

headline.print_headline: Tell Me Your Idea (and Don’t Mind the Silly Putty)
headline.seo: Laurel Richie of the W.N.B.A., on Encouraging Ideas
headline.main: Tell Me Your Idea (and Don’t Mind the Silly Putty)
